intro: Pichonia lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's pichonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks and in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
